channel.title: MorningBrew as a feed
channel.description: This is a feed of recent MorningBrew articles published by Huginn

item.title: Black unemployment falls to historic low
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Last month, just 4.7% of Black workers in the US didn’t have a job and were looking for one, according to data the Bureau of Labor Statistics released yesterday. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeBlack unemployment hit a record low for the second consecutive month in April, as the labor market stayed red hot and defied all those recession predictions. Yeah, but…this latest labor market thermometer reading could tempt the Fed to keep cranking up the AC (or at least hold off on dialing it down): Jerome Powell & Co. want the labor market to chill out a bit to help curb inflation.
item.author: Sam Klebanov

item.title: Warren Buffett dished out hot takes at the Berkshire Hathaway shareholders meeting
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. “It just happens to be a better business than any we own,” Buffett said. On Berkshire’s investment in Apple: The value of Berkshire’s stake in Apple has ballooned to $151 billion, amounting to nearly half the value of its entire stock portfolio. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! I see no option for any other currency to be the reserve currency,” Buffett said. Buffett thinks the government was right to intervene to protect SVB depositors, claiming, “It would have been catastrophic” otherwise.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: 8 killed while shopping in Texas
item.description: . The US is No. 1 with 121 per 100 people. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Also in Texas this weekend: Seven people were killed at a bus stop in the border city of Brownsville after they were hit by a Land Rover. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}.

item.title: Debt ceiling takes the floor
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One approach would be to invoke a clause in the 14th Amendment to the Constitution, which affirms the sanctity of public debt, so the Federal government can keep borrowing in order to continue paying its existing creditors. Last month, the GOP-controlled House passed a bill that would lift the borrowing cap and slash government spending by around $3.2 trillion over 10 years. Republicans in Congress say they won’t increase the debt limit without budget cuts. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. He says it would fill Treasury coffers while keeping on-paper debt below the limit.
item.author: Sam Klebanov

item.title: Brew Classifieds: Week of May 1
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Just one problem: All of the shoes were for the right foot. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. —MM
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Desperately seeking marinara sauce
item.description: . One tweet that garnered more than 5 million views read, “someone very mysteriously dumped 3-400 pounds of pasta in the woods in old bridge, nj …… i need to know everything.” Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. The internet went macaroni this week over photos of what one state official called “15 wheelbarrow loads” of dry pasta dumped in the woods in central New Jersey. was one of the top comments on the Reddit thread tagged “Weird NJ.” —ML “Italian grandmas: why would someone dump four servings of pasta in the woods like that?” css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeNew Jerseyans need to keep a couple of things in mind when hiking: Watch out for two kinds of venomous snakes and—wait, whose pasta is that?
item.author: Molly Liebergall

item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Last month, just 4.7% of Black workers in the US didn’t have a job and were looking for one, according to data the Bureau of Labor Statistics released yesterday. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeBlack unemployment hit a record low for the second consecutive month in April, as the labor market stayed red hot and defied all those recession predictions. item.title: Horse deaths cloud this year’s Kentucky Derby
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThere’s a pretty big shadow cast over today’s Kentucky Derby, and it’s not even from all the big hats. Bob Baffert, his trainer and one of the most well-known people in the sport, received a two-year suspension from Churchill Downs after the incident. This year the drama started long before any of the horses lined up to run the one-and-a-quarter-mile track at Churchill Downs: Five horses died in the week leading up to the Run for the Roses. —MM On Thursday, Churchill Downs suspended Joseph indefinitely and pulled his horse, Lord Miles, from the Derby, saying, “We have reasonable concerns about the condition of his horses.”
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Young and wild and eyeing an NHL team
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Full-circle moment: The NHL team that holds the soon-to-be-broken record for highest sale ($900 million) is the same one whose jersey Snoop wore in the 1994 music video for Gin and Juice: the Pittsburgh Penguins. Snoop has competitionIt’s Ryan Reynolds. —ML
item.author: Molly Liebergall

item.title: Britain’s economy rains on Charles’s parade
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. One anti-monarchy group, Republic, is using the coronation as an opportunity to protest. What’s going down: The coronation, which celebrates King Charles III’s ascent to the throne, will start with a procession from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Abbey. The BBC will provide coverage all day, but for Brits who aren’t tempted by the crown jewels, rival Channel 4 will offer a variety of their own programming, including comedian Frankie Boyle’s documentary Farewell to the Monarchy. —CC Most of the royal family’s wealth can be attributed to vast real estate portfolios, such as the Duchy of Cornwall, the Duchy of Lancaster, and the Crown Estate, which account for nearly 500,000 acres of land. There, Charles will be anointed as the head of the Church of England, presented with a scepter and an orb, and given a crown worth $57 million to wear for a hot second before he ascends the literal throne in front of 2,200 guests (not including Meghan Markle). King Charles’s net worth is the subject of much intrigue and is estimated to be between $750 million and $1.4 billion. Queen Elizabeth II’s coronation cost £1.57 million in 1953—or more than $70 million in today’s dollars. With 1.2 million people expected to party it up in London, celebrations for the coronation—think pubs open all day long, hotels booked up, and cardboard cutouts of Charles and Camilla—will bring in an extra $437 million, UKHospitality estimates. As for the coronation itself, programming starts at 5am ET on several TV channels in the US.
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: What to say so you sound like you were paying attention to earnings reports
item.description: . item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Queen Elizabeth II’s coronation cost £1.57 million in 1953—or more than $70 million in today’s dollars. item.title: New York nixes gas stoves in new buildings
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. On Tuesday, the state became the first to ban natural gas in new buildings as part of a slide toward electric power. Some cities—San Francisco, New York City, and Seattle—have passed their own natural gas bans. The ban—slated to go into effect starting in 2026—would apply to all natural gas facilities in new residential buildings and some commercial ones (restaurants, hospitals, and, um, crematoriums are exempt). —CC css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! The ban will help New York meet its strict greenhouse gas emissions goals. A partisan debate ignited, and it’s still burning:Republican lawmakers oppose any ban, citing energy cost increases, while many Democrats support a ban to curb climate change. But 20 Republican-controlled state legislatures have preemptively enacted laws that prohibit cities from banning natural gas. Though the problem has been known for years, the issue came off the back burner in January when a US Consumer Product Safety Commission official publicly floated a national ban. css-1dlcpt7[data-disabled]{opacity:0.4;background-color:rgba(0,0,0,. Natural gas comes with adverse health effects, according to the International Journal of Environmental Research and Public Health, as well as detrimental environmental impacts.
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: Airbnb pushes single-room rentals in wake of tightening travel budgets
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. It hit $153 last year, but single-room rentals cost $67 per night on average. The company said the average daily price of renting an Airbnb has jumped 36% in the last three years. The short-term rental company rolled out a whole suite of upgrades yesterday, the biggest being a new feature to facilitate renting cheaper single rooms in shared homes. —MM Big picture: Despite everyone piling on Airbnb hosts’ unhinged checkout requests (including us! css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Rate Hike: Episode X - A New Hope
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. While eager investors always read a lot into any small update, this time even Fed Chair Jerome Powell acknowledged it was a “meaningful change” when asked about it at a press conference. The tweak removed a line included in other recent statements that said the Fed “anticipates” additional rate increases. So, if the Fed is going to come off the rate-raising tear it’s been on since March 2022, inflation needs to keep slowing. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThese Fed sequels are starting to feel repetitive: The Federal Reserve raised interest rates by another 25 basis points yesterday—the 10th rate hike in a little over a year. But with all the rate hikes the Fed has made already—not to mention the recent failures of three banks, which forced financial institutions to raise their lending standards—inflation is likely to keep coming down. But the hike cycle may be broken soonThe Fed hasn’t made any promises (it never does), but economists are hopeful that a revision to the Fed’s language in the statement it put out yesterday—coupled with recent slowdowns in inflation and hiring—may indicate an upcoming pause in rate hikes. The hike puts interest rates above 5% for the first time since 2007, as stubborn inflation has prompted the Fed’s fastest series of rate increases since the 1980s. —ML
item.author: Molly Liebergall

item.title: AI fears cut Chegg in half
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Zoom out: Chegg’s warning about ChatGPT stands in stark contrast to the companies mentioning AI to excite investors: On their earnings calls last week, Meta, Alphabet, Microsoft, and Amazon collectively dropped “AI” 168 times, according to Insider. It’s the first instance of a company warning that ChatGPT was eating into its business that we know of. Chegg has partnered with ChatGPT-creator OpenAI to develop its own conversational AI tool Cheggmate, which it’ll start testing this month. The AI anxiety spread to other education companies: Shares in publisher Pearson and language-learning app Duolingo dropped about 15% and 10%, respectively. —SK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! Meanwhile, Duolingo released a subscription tier that lets users practice their language skills with an AI bot and has an AI-powered tool to explain mistakes. So, how to combat ChatGPT disrupting your business?
item.author: Sam Klebanov

item.title: WGA strike means we’re about to see some weird stuff on TV
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. What does TV look like without its writers? —CC While the boom in reality TV was underway before the previous strike, the lack of competition from scripted series helped juice the genre’s ratings: Over 31 million people tuned in to watch their crush David Archuleta lose to David Cook in the American Idol finale in 2008. css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none!
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: VC funding dropped to $18 billion last month
item.description: . One sector that’s on the up-and-up: AI, partly due to increased investor interest in generative AI tools like ChatGPT and Bard. Companies in the AI space are raising at high valuations, Teare said, but despite the spike, the sector wasn’t enough to buoy the rest of the tech industry’s numbers. The technologies that will shape the future of business, all in one newsletter. “Every single funding stage is down from the peaks of 2021, but I think seed funding has stayed the most robust—it’s the least impacted by what’s happening—and then…Series A is stronger than Series B,” Teare said, adding, “It’ll be interesting to see how that market—the newer companies being formed…what those valuations and what those round sizes look like into 2023.” Looking aheadAcross the board, investors seem to be choosier about their investments, and since the “heat has gone away from the market…it’s just a much more selective funding environment overall,” Teare said. Top-up roundsBut Teare said her team has seen more companies raise extension rounds—especially if they need extra money to carry them through to their next big milestone or larger-scale funding round, in a presumably less challenging funding environment. “What we’ve seen now is that, broadly, for the tech industry, that companies are not able to raise…that next big master round, and so they’re raising extensions…funding to sort of tide over that company for the next 12 to 18 months, to get them through to a funding environment which is a little bit stronger.” “Typically, you raise rounds every 18 to 24 months, and we were seeing companies raise more often…some more at 12 to 18 months…largely because they could in this funding environment,” Teare said.
item.author: Hayden Field

item.title: WGA strike means we’re about to see some weird stuff on TV
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. item.title: Pornhub shuts down site in Utah ahead of new age verification law
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeGoogle searches for “VPN” have skyrocketed in Utah this week for one reason: You can no longer visit Pornhub from a Utah IP address. Louisiana implemented a similar law in January, but unlike Utah, it has a digital ID program that residents can use to verify their age and access adult sites. If you fire up Incognito Mode and head to Pornhub with an IP address in the state of Utah, you’ll be diverted to a page that has an adult performer (SFW) reading a statement from the site that claims “giving your ID card every time you want to visit an adult platform is not the most effective solution for protecting our users.” Counterpoint: Social media companies warn that restricting access to their sites would limit free speech and push younger users to less safe, more-fringe corners of the internet—an argument echoed by Pornhub in its opposition to the Utah bill. —MM To protest a new age restriction law that goes into effect today, MindGeek’s adult sites, including Pornhub, blocked access to its content in Utah.
item.author: Matty Merritt

item.title: Choupette and owner Karl Lagerfeld honored at Met Gala
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. “Everything that Karl represented is something that we all generally are very against,” one of the account organizers told the Washington Post. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIf you couldn’t guess by the parade of sunglasses and feline homages, the theme of last night’s annual Met Gala fundraiser at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, “Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty,” commemorated the late fashion playmaker and father to the world’s fanciest cat, Choupette. —CC
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: What’s next for banks?
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. For now…no one knows if the credits are truly rolling on the banking crisis, but investors seemed to take Dimon’s assurances to heart: Stocks didn’t tank yesterday like they did after the bank failures in March. Purchasing beleaguered banks has been part of its growth strategy for some time, but the bank has experienced buyer’s remorse in the past: JPMorgan had to deal with legal issues and extra expenses when it took over Bear Stearns during the 2008 financial crisis. “This part of the crisis is over,” Dimon said, reasoning that after the three recent bank collapses, there just aren’t many more financial institutions with a large share of uninsured deposits to make them vulnerable to panics. JPMorgan took over First Republic (and its affluent client list), in return for $10.6 billion paid to regulators and other financial concessions. —SK css-1dlcpt7[data-readonly]{box-shadow:none! The aerobic advice came after the banking heavyweight got even bulkier by gobbling up most of the assets of failed First Republic Bank. Are more banking crises coming? But Dimon thinks this time is different, as First Republic had a simpler business model.
item.author: Sam Klebanov

item.title: The ‘Godfather of AI’ fears his own creation
item.description: . He did so, he said, to be able to speak freely about the dangers of AI without worrying about impacting the company. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeThe chorus of tech leaders calling for a moratorium on AI development just gained one of the most commanding voices in the sector: Geoffrey Hinton, a trailblazing creator of the deep-learning techniques that underpin ChatGPT and other rapidly evolving AI systems.
item.author: Molly Liebergall

item.title: Choupette and owner Karl Lagerfeld honored at Met Gala
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. “Everything that Karl represented is something that we all generally are very against,” one of the account organizers told the Washington Post. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIf you couldn’t guess by the by the parade of sunglasses and feline homages, the theme of last night’s annual Met Gala fundraiser at the Metropolitan Museum of Art, “Karl Lagerfeld: A Line of Beauty,” commemorated the late fashion playmaker and father to the world’s fanciest cat, Choupette. —CC
item.author: Cassandra Cassidy

item.title: Hollywood braces for writers’ strike
item.description: . Studios have been stockpiling scripts ahead of the May 1 deadline, so scripted TV shows would continue for awhile. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIf production companies and unionized writers don’t reach a new contract by midnight tonight, the scribes will put down their No. 2 pencils and strike for the first time in 15 years. Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. Last month, 97.85% of eligible members of the Writers Guild of America, which represents most of the working writers in Hollywood, voted to authorize a strike if an agreement with major studios wasn’t reached. Here’s why…Shorter series: In the previous TV era, shows like How I Met Your Mother reliably churned out seasons with 20+ episodes. What happens if they strike?
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: No Shave November in May…but for lawns
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. In past years, participants have watched their lawns transform from an “ecological dead zone”—as one professor calls the average American yard—into a tall-grassed ecosystem rife with bumblebees, songbirds, chipmunks, and other forest friends... But some environmentalists say No Mow May isn’t the right way to bring biodiversity back to residential areas because it “teases” insects and other pollinators. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeTo mow or not to mow? —ML That is the question homeowners are debating as more cities and towns embrace No Mow May, a movement started in 2019 to revitalize backyard wildlife by refraining from lawn care for an entire month. The Guelph Turfgrass Institute suggests channeling the benefits of No Mow May throughout the other 11 months by sectioning off a part of the yard as a permanent “wildflower zone.”
item.author: Molly Liebergall

item.title: Why your super online friends are talking about Bluesky
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. On a decentralized platform, one person does not have the power to create rules that govern the entire ecosystem. One of the most recently disillusioned people with Musk is none other than Dorsey. Bluesky is very similar to Twitter, which makes sense since it was originally a side project of Twitter’s and is funded by former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeIf you aren’t on the internet as much as I am (which…congrats, that’s healthier), then you might not have heard of Bluesky, a social media app that’s gaining traction as an alternative to Twitter. Writing on Bluesky, Dorsey said “it all went south” once Musk bought Twitter.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: The big get bigger: JPMorgan to acquire First Republic
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeAnother one bites the dust: Authorities seized First Republic Bank this morning and sold most of its assets to JPMorgan, the country’s largest bank. First Republic tried to weather the storm itself, but after customers withdrew more than $100 billion in deposits in Q1 and its share price plunged nearly 75% last week alone, the government had to hang the “closed” sign on the door. But by quickly finding a buyer over the weekend, the government avoided the unsavory tactic it had to deploy for SVB: protecting deposits over the federally insured cap of $250,000. JPMorgan said it will assume First Republic’s $92 billion in deposits, which is a welcome outcome since making SVB depositors whole cost the FDIC’s Deposit Insurance Fund about $20 billion. First Citizens collected the scraps of SVB, New York Community Bank snatched up assets of Signature Bank, and UBS absorbed crosstown rival Credit Suisse. Like SVB, First Republic is a midsized California-based lender with a specific client base—in this case, wealthy individuals—that made it particularly exposed to the shockwaves of the recent banking turmoil.
item.author: Neal Freyman

item.title: How chess became the hot new esport
item.description: . Become smarter in just 5 minutesGet the daily email that makes reading the news actually enjoyable. css-y2oq5g[data-hover][data-disabled]{background:var(--colors-primary);opacity:0.5;}SubscribeUnlike in the chess heydays of the last century, one need not be a Bobby Fischer-level genius to achieve chess stardom now. The sport was likely helped along last year by a perfect hype storm created by Magnus Carlsen, the world’s No. 1 chess player, accusing an opponent of cheating in an in-person game, as well as a Louis Vuitton campaign in which Messi and Ronaldo faced off across a chess board. One of the most popular chess YouTubers, Levy Rozman, is a pro, but he lacks the grandmaster designation of top-tier players. css-y2oq5g{display:-webkit-inline-box;display:-webkit-inline-flex;display:-ms-inline-flexbox;display:inline-flex;-webkit-appearance:none;-moz-appearance:none;-ms-appearance:none;appearance:none;-webkit-align-items:center;-webkit-box-align:center;-ms-flex-align:center;align-items:center;-webkit-box-pack:center;-ms-flex-pack:center;-webkit-justify-content:center;justify-content:center;-webkit-user-select:none;-moz-user-select:none;-ms-user-select:none;user-select:none;position:relative;white-space:nowrap;vertical-align:middle;outline:2px solid transparent;outline-offset:2px;width:auto;line-height:1.2;border-radius:var(--chakra-radii-md);font-weight:var(--chakra-fontWeights-semibold);transition-property:var(--chakra-transition-property-common);transition-duration:var(--chakra-transition-duration-normal);height:var(--chakra-sizes-10);min-width:var(--chakra-sizes-10);font-size:var(--chakra-fontSizes-md);-webkit-padding-start:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-start:var(--chakra-space-4);-webkit-padding-end:var(--chakra-space-4);padding-inline-end:var(--chakra-space-4);color:var(--chakra-colors-white);background:var(--colors-primary);radius:var(--border-radius);}. The company hopes that the Champions Chess Tour will become the flagship event “for all of chess” in the future, a spokesperson for Chess.
item.author: Sam Klebanov
